function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Development of infectious disease ontologies for modeling different types of diseases.","Impact":"Increased potential for misinterpretation or misuse of ontologies leading to inaccurate public health decisions.","Mitigation":"Thorough validation and peer review of ontologies by domain experts and public health professionals.","Technologies":"Ontology validation tools, peer review platforms, and collaborative knowledge sharing platforms for domain experts and public health professionals.","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, social media analysts, and researchers.","Owner":"Domain experts, public health organizations, and research institutions."},{"Description":"Use of social media data for infectious disease surveillance and monitoring.","Impact":"Risk of misinterpretation or misrepresentation of disease trends leading to inaccurate public health decisions.","Mitigation":"Validation of social media data with traditional surveillance methods, integration of expert domain knowledge, and verification by public health professionals.","Technologies":"Text mining and natural language processing tools, social media analytics platforms, and integration frameworks for traditional and social media surveillance data.","People":"Social media analysts, public health officials, epidemiologists, and researchers.","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions, and social media analytics teams."},{"Description":"Utilization of web-based tools for visualizing spatial-temporal disease spread.","Impact":"Potential for misinterpretation of disease spread patterns leading to ineffective public health interventions.","Mitigation":"Validation of visualization results with traditional epidemiological data, expert review of visualization methods, and integration of spatial-temporal analysis by public health professionals.","Technologies":"Geospatial visualization tools, interactive mapping platforms, and integration frameworks for spatial-temporal disease data.","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, social media analysts, and researchers.","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions, and technology development teams."}]}
